decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a potent combo involving Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate infinite mana and mill your opponent's entire library. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and manipulation to help find key pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of countermagic and removal spells, as well as utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently cycling through your deck to set up a game-winning combo while disrupting your opponent's game plan.

This deck is focused on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to continuously loop spells from the graveyard, enabling a powerful combo with Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to mill the opponent's library. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student also helps with card selection and recursion. The deck utilizes artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga for ramp and provides disruption with cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Spell Snare. The goal is to set up the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of spells and mill their entire deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer leading the charge, supported by removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. The inclusion of Static Prison and Arena of Glory helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your creatures. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain momentum to secure a fast victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, enabling a combo finish with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Grinding Station. The deck's strategy is to disrupt the opponent while setting up its combo pieces with card draw from Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact synergy and utility, while Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble help accelerate its game plan. The deck aims to control the board and win through a quick and explosive combo.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Amulet Titan deck is to utilize the synergy between Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and other land ramp cards to quickly assemble the mana needed to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck aims to tutor for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and utilize their abilities to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Urza's Saga further enhance the deck's ability to generate mana and create advantageous board states.

This deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, while also utilizing Urza's Saga to generate value and Urza lands to ramp up mana production. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble provide additional combo pieces to enable powerful plays. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for card selection and manipulation, ultimately leading to a win condition with Thassa's Oracle or overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize, counter magic like Force of Negation, and efficient removal like Fatal Push. The deck aims to protect its threats like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus while gradually grinding out advantage with card draw from spells like Consider and Thought Scour. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and out-valuing them in the long game, this deck seeks to maintain control of the board and eventually finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Archon of Cruelty, Troll of Khazad-dûm, Nethergoyf, and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck also utilizes cards like Persist and Detective's Phoenix to maintain pressure and card advantage. The deck includes a mix of removal spells including Fatal Push and Tarfire to control the board. Mishra's Bauble and Faithless Looting help to dig for key cards while Street Wraith provides additional card draw. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, burn spells, and disruptive cards. The deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Phlage and Ragavan, while also using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage. Static Prison and Thraben Charm help to control the board, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional support and value. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to its powerful spells and abilities.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard disruption. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the board with powerful threats like Abhorrent Oculus and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize helps to handle threats early on, while cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Unearth provide additional value and card advantage. The deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and slowly grinding out a win.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using various mana accelerants and lands, and then cast powerful Eldrazi creatures to control the game. With the help of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Command, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up to play high-cost threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The inclusion of cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble also provides some board control and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on casting spells with Cascade to put multiple threats onto the battlefield quickly. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea, the deck can cascade into powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Crashing Footfalls. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the board while overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. Additionally, Leyline Binding provides additional utility by tapping down opponents' creatures. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolor requirements for Cascade spells.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By controlling the board and manipulating the opponent's resources, it aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantages. The deck includes spells like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Thought Scour to disrupt the opponent's plans, while also utilizing creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to pressure the opponent and provide additional utility. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards and putting creatures into the graveyard to eventually cast Living End, a powerful sorcery that reanimates all creatures from the graveyard. The deck includes various creatures with cycling abilities, as well as cards that can put creatures in the graveyard without casting them. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden board presence after casting Living End, potentially winning the game in just one turn. The deck also includes counterspells and support cards to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on stalling the game and controlling the opponent's board through counterspells and removal spells, while ramping up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures. The key strategy is to assemble Urza's lands, known as UrzaTron, in order to generate large amounts of mana quickly and cast game-winning threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Karn, the Great Creator also plays a crucial role in shutting down opponent's artifacts and locking them out of the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with massive threats while maintaining control over the game.
